settings.heading: How much water intake is ideal?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
While the amount of water recommended for each individual is dependent on a number of factors, typically about 2 liters a day is recommended for women and 3 liters a day is recommended for men. 

However, you can consume too much water which may result in you having abnormally low levels of sodium (called hyponatremia) in your blood.

settings.heading: What are the symptoms of dehydration?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
• Feeling thirsty or parched
  • Dark yellow urine
  • Strong smelling urine
  • Feeling dizzy
  • Dry mouth
  • Dry Eyes
  • Dry lips
  • Palpitations or high heart rate with low blood pressure
  • Muscle cramps

settings.heading: What causes dehydration?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
The cause of dehydration is typically lack of water intake, however reduced or inadequate water intake can be due to a number of factors such as:

Lack of access: Difficulty accessing clean water can often result in dehydration and chronic dehydration.

Not drinking enough: Many individuals have difficulty consuming as much water as is recommended. This can result in dehydration.

Sickness: Being ill with the flu, a cold, or a chronic condition can result in sudden (or consistent) issues with water retention. If you have the flu or a cold, try to drink plenty of water and fluids to help balance the system.

This will also help your body regulate temperature and can help prevent severe fever.  If you have a chronic condition resulting in consistent dehydration, you should speak to your doctor about possible solutions and treatments.

Excessive exercise/sweating: While exercising has many health benefits, exercising in peak heat conditions or for long periods of time can result in dehydration. If you are exercising, it is important to drink water regularly and to avoid working out under severe heat conditions.

Temperature: Being out in the sunshine can cause dehydration. It is important to take frequent breaks when you are speaking time outdoors, seek shade regularly, and drink water.

settings.heading: What does dehydration do to the brain and body?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans: When your body does not have the proper amount of fluids it needs to function optimally, some functions will be impaired. This is why often when someone becomes dehydrated they will lose stamina for normal daily activities, experience brain fog, and feel lethargic and/or tired.

settings.heading: Can dehydration be serious?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Yes, dehydration can become quite serious if it is not corrected. It also is a greater risk to infants and children, the elderly, and those with chronic illness. Dehydration, if left untreated, can result in heat injury, urinary and kidney issues, and seizures. 

Can dehydration cause hair loss?

While hair loss isn't often thought of as having a relation to water intake, it actually does impact hair health and growth. Severe dehydration and chronic dehydration can result in accelerated hair loss, or a reduced hair growth rate.

settings.heading: Is hair loss caused that is caused by dehydration permanent?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Typically, hair loss caused by dehydration is reversible. Once you begin drinking adequate amounts of water, your hair growth cycles should resume as normal. However, if your dehydration is caused by an underlying condition then that will need to be treated.

If you feel chronically dehydrated and have noticed it impacting your health, then we recommend that you speak directly to your doctor. They will be able to investigate any possible underlying conditions that may be linked to your dehydration.
